description: UNCLE Colindale - a stunningly designed development nestled in a bustling and vibrant community in North-West London. Its spacious and quiet apartments come with designer furniture and top spec appliances, plus amazing amenity spaces including a gym designed - in collaboration with some of London's leading personal trainers and dedicated coworking space. And if all that isn't enough, it's only 22 minutes from your front door to King's Cross. Pretty great, right? UNCLE Colindale is now open and accepting move ins from December 2022. This is the newest UNCLE building and is designed with stylish interior, furnished by BoConcept or if it's your preference, we also have unfurnished apartments. We have on-site resident managers & spacious amenity spaces with our gym and wellness space opening in the summer of 2023. As well as its amazing studio apartments, UNCLE Colindale has friendly and helpful on-site Resident Managers that live on the property. They are there to help ensure your home is the amazing place it should be - including sorting any maintenance and looking after your parcel deliveries.  If the ideal travel links weren't enough, there's some beautiful scenery right on your doorstep. You're a short walk from the Silk Stream which flows through some of the most iconic parts of North-West London. There's even walking tours available that elevate the walk from a joyous jaunt to a fascinating and educational adventure about your new neighbourhood. And not far away either is the equally wonderful Montrose Park. With everything from a locally loved café (seriously, read the reviews if you don't believe us), to a skatepark and playing fields hosting bootcamps and yoga classes. In addition to this there is the Bang Bang oriental food hall within walking distance to curb your appetite.  In a nutshell, you're looking at beautiful apartments with designer furniture in Zone 4 with amazing access to central London and a gym, Peloton studio, coworking space, plus wonderful on-site Resident Managers and the amazing UNCLE community. And at a great price. What's not to love? UNCLE is renting as it should be. What does that mean for you? That means on-site resident managers that know your name, look after your packages if you're out and help you get settled in. It means never having to worry about that leaky tap. It means coming home to relax on your luxurious BoConcept sofa before heading to the Peloton studio for a workout. It means, as a renter, finally being treated with the respect you deserve. As we like to say, there's no place like UNCLE - and we mean it. Get in touch today to arrange a viewing so you can experience a simpler way of renting. * These pictures depict our furnished UNCLE flats & may not relate to a specific apartment type** BoConcept furniture available in furnished apartments only*** Gym and wellness space due to open in Summer 2023

description: Available is this seventh floor 2 bedroom apartment in Montreal House, part of the Maple Quays development at Canada Water, SE16. The property comprises a large open plan living space, which benefits from a fully integrated modern kitchen (integrated dishwasher, oven, hob, fridge and freezer and microwave), and a spacious balcony with stunning views overlooking London. There is a spacious master bedroom with a Jack and Jill bathroom and a single second room, available furnished or un-furnished. With access to an onsite private gym, for residents only and a friendly and professional concierge service, this offers the peak of modern living. The building is located mere moments from Canada Water station which is on the Jubilee Line, and the Overground to Highbury & Islington. There is also a large bus station very close by, which offers fantastic transport links throughout the day and night.

address: No.2, Upper Riverside, Cutter Lane, Greenwich Peninsula, SE10
description: A luxury two bedroom, two bathroom apartment, located at Upper Riverside, Building 2, Greenwich Peninsula. Situated on the 4th floor complete with access to residents' swimming pool, gyms, roof terraces and 24 hour concierge. The apartment consists of a very spacious living and kitchen area, with real wood flooring throughout. The kitchen has real marble worktops and built in appliances, including dishwasher. Both bedrooms are a great size, with the master coming complete with luxury en-suite bathroom, housing free standing cubicle. There are also built in wardrobes in both bedrooms. The master bathroom comes complete with shower over bathtub. Additional benefits include large private balcony with stunning views.Living in Upper Riverside is much more than living in your own individual apartment, you are part of something much greater. This stunning family of five light filled, glass and stone towers, with roof gardens cascading to the edge of the Thames, occupies one of the best riverside locations in London. You will become part of the exclusive Upper Riverside Club, with private access to the gyms, sauna, a 15th floor swimming pool with panoramic views, rooftop terraces, shared spaces and more. The gardens connected to the riverfront will have river cafes, different types of retails and lively public spaces. Upper Riverside links to Peninsula Square with access to the Underground at North Greenwich (Jubilee Line), the O2, friendly restaurants and buzzy social areas.Call Greenwich Peninsula to book your viewing.

This home comes fully furnished and is located on the 6th floor of Raywood Mansions, just across Victory Park and a few steps from the Wetlands – relaxing greens areas on the border of East Village and Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. The open plan kitchen and living room area opens onto a private balcony, offering incomparable views, and there is a fully integrated kitchen. There are two double bedrooms and two bathrooms, one of which is an ensuite shower room, and all bedrooms have spacious fitted wardrobes. This home also features underfloor heating throughout the home, wooden floors in the open plan living area and new soft carpet in the bedrooms. All just  300 metres from Stratford International Station and Westfield Shopping Centre.Raywood Mansions

description: Contemporary design and décor, this modern two bedroom, two bathroom unfurnished flat offers enjoyable living spaces and provides residents with views over the local area with flats on higher floors offering stunning views across the London skyline. Situated directly opposite Colliers Wood Underground Station, the location is perhaps the biggest advantage of these modern, high spec flats. Look no further!Large and spacious family home. The accommodation comprises; Front reception, rear reception, conservatory, large kitchen/diner, four bedrooms, WC and bathroom. The property further benefits from a very large boarded loft. To the rear there is a delightful mature garden with a westerly aspect and private outlook. With Sydenham High Street only moments away and Sydenham station with excellent links to London Bridge and also the East London line.Location:General information:Less than 200 years ago Sydenham was a sleepy hamlet in the Kent countryside. All changed in 1852 when the Directors of the Railway company had the bright idea of buying and moving the Crystal Palace built by St Joseph Paxton for the Great Exhibition in 1851 from Hyde Park to Sydenham. Their idea was to encourage Londoners to take a day out 'in the country' to visit the new enlarged Crystal Palace set in its own pleasure gardens complete with pools, fountains and even a Dinosaur Theme Park. A sort of combination of Disneyland and Jurassic Park!This transformed Sydenham into a fashionable Victorian town for Londoners to visit which inevitably grew and merged to now make Sydenham an integral multi-ethnic part of South East London. The FA Cup was played here, Colour TV was invented here, the first pneumatic railway ran through Sydenham and many famous & notorious people have made it their homeIn 1871 Sydenham was imortalised in the works of the exiled Camille Pissaro - the most famous of which, a view along Lawrie Park Avenue towards St Bart's Church, now hangs in the National Gallery. Other famous residents of Sydenham have included Ernest Shackleton, the Antartic explorer, Sir George Groves, compiler of the musical dictionary, and W G Grace, England's greatest cricketer.Sydenham station has recently opened the East London tube line extension that connects Sydenham to Surrey Quays and Islington Council Tax Band:  Holding Deposit: £0.00

The principal suite is quietly positioned to the rear of the property with a dressing room enjoying floor-to-ceiling fitted storage and a spacious en suite featuring a free-standing bath, a double basin and a heated towel rail. *Available furnished or unfurnished!*Looking for a brand-new apartment with dual-aspect light – set in one of the tallest residential developments in London?This luxury balcony 2-bed (778 sq ft) on the 23rd floor of the new Icon Building comes with underfloor heating and floor-to-ceiling windows, a private balcony facing south, and a northwest and southwest-facing dual aspect for the best of the natural light throughout the day and the evening.As you step through onto the engineered wood flooring of your new entrance hallway, you’ll find the first of two bedrooms straight ahead, with a northwest-facing aspect to capture the bright morning sun.Next to the bedroom, you’ll find an additional enclosed storage area, with the first of two bathrooms opposite – complete with a heated towel rail, ceramic floor tiling, and prestigious finishings by Laufen and Hans Grohe.As you explore further down the hallway, you’ll come to the apartment’s master bedroom, with a southwest-facing aspect for the best of the warm evening light.You’ll also find a private en-suite bathroom attached to the master bedroom, with similar high specifications to the main bathroom.Across from the master bedroom, this high-spec apartment opens out into a bright and airy open-plan living, dining, and kitchen area. And the first thing you’ll notice is the abundance of natural light pouring in through the floor-to-ceiling windows of its northwest and southwest-facing dual aspect.To your right, you’ll find a fully equipped and custom-designed kitchen area, complete with feature-lit cabinetry over a granite worktop, as well as a full range of integrated appliances by Bosch or similar (including an extractor over a touch-control ceramic hob and oven, a combination microwave, a fridge-freezer, and a dishwasher).As you cross the wooden flooring of your new living room, you’ll open the doors to the fresh air of your own private, south-facing balcony. It’s an ideal outdoor spot, with 23rd-floor views perfectly positioned to capture the full natural light throughout the day – and it’s a welcome extra space for when you’re entertaining guests.Beyond the walls of your immaculate new home, you’ll be a part of the Icon Building residents’ community, along with all the facilities and amenities that entails. As a resident of Icon Building, you’ll have access to:•	A 5-Star Gym with Yoga, Meditation, and a Holistic Suite•	Private Dining with Hire Facilities•	A Private Bar with a Courtyard Lounge•	A Residents’ Screening Room•	A Cocktail Bar, Coffee & Breakfast Bar•	A Private Roof Garden•	A Co-working Office Space•	And a 24-hour Concierge Service.You’ll be just a 2-minute walk from the Central Line at North Acton Station, giving you direct links into the city through Oxford Street, Bank, and Liverpool Street – as well as a 9-minute walk from the rail services at Acton Main Line for direct links to Paddington or Heathrow.It’s just a 10-minute walk to the green open spaces of the nearby North Acton Playing Fields – and only 15 minutes to the Paddington Branch of the Regent’s Canal, for waterside walks within reach of your door.This brand-new and high-spec 2-bed in one of London’s highest residential developments comes with immaculate interiors, a northwest and southwest-facing dual aspect, and a south-facing private balcony for maximum natural light.And that means a desirable property like this won’t be around for long.So if you’re looking for a luxury apartment in a high-spec new development – with transport, green spaces, and a huge range of on-site facilities – give us a call and we’ll show you everything life at Icon Building has to offer.

description: Situated in the heart of Bow, Trading Places are delighted to offer a stunning, modern two bedroom, two bathroom flat available to rent now. Offered on a furnished basis, this property benefits from double glazing, gas central heating and a secure gated entry system.Entry to the property is via the main gate. Once you access the block, the property is on the third floor. As you step through the door, you are welcomed by a long hallway stretching to the reception room. Carpeted throughout, the property's general condition is well kept and has been recently redecorated and cleaned. On the left is bedroom number one. This comprises of a double bed and mattress, a side table and wardrobe with more than enough space left over. The walls are washed white and the carpets a creamy beige. The light bounces off the walls keeping the room nice and bright. Further along the hallway to the left, is the second bedroom with an en-suite. Keeping its bright, modern features, this bedroom offers a double bed and mattress with a headboard, a chest of drawers, a side table and a built in storage unit. Plenty of space remaining in the room for extra bedroom furnishings. The en-suite, laid with tiles throughout is creatively organised with the wash basin in front, toilet to the left and shower to the right. Back along the hallway, there is a storage unit with storage space available and also holds a washing machine. Next to the storage unit is the three piece bathroom. Very spacious and also tiled throughout. The reception room, at the back of the property, is offered with a two seater sofa and a small dining table with chairs. The living space is plentiful and you get French doors that open out to a brilliant view of Canary Wharf. Further into the reception room you get access to the kitchen which has a lot of cupboard and worktop space and is offered with a gas hob, oven, extractor fan, fridge freezer and dishwasher.Getting around Bow is quite easy. Transport links are ample with bus routes available and train stations. The closest station is the DLR, Devons Road, approximately a 10 minute walk from the property, gives you easy access to Canary Wharf and Stratford. The Underground Station, Mile End, is a 13 minute walk and allows you to get into Central London quickly. Supermarkets in the area are also accessible with shops within a 5 minute walk of the property. A 5 minute walk down the road and you reach Mile End Park which has a lot of greenery and space to explore. This property is available now. To arrange viewings, please contact our Lettings Team.COUNCIL TAX BAND - DDEPOSIT - £2,250.00These property particulars have been prepared by Trading Places Estate and Letting Agents under the instruction of the owner and shall not constitute an offer or the basis of any contract. We have not tested any of the appliances, services or connections unless legally required to do so. All measurements are subject to a margin of error, and photographs and floorplans are for guidance purposes only intended as general information. It cannot be inferred items shown are included in the letting, so please seek to verify what items come with the property.

Located in the very heart of SE1 within the historic surroundings of Southwark and Bankside is this lovely period townhouse. Set across four floors and offering generous living space throughout, this characterful, three-bedroom, two bathroom property is offered in immaculate condition, striking the perfect balance between modern fixtures and period charm. This wonderful 1079 Sq Ft home will certainly appeal to those looking for property with a story to tell and certainly houses of this type and location are incredibly rare to the market. Approaching the property, you initially discover a small entrance hall that leads to the main reception. The 21Ft through lounge is naturally bright due to its East and West aspect and has a calming ambience, with ample space for seating and dining. Enhancing the feel further you have bespoke window shutters and window seat and views and steps down into the walled garden. Downstairs you discover the fully fitted kitchen diner. Modern and cleverly bright via several light windows, and a sash window to the front, the room provides space for a family dining table and is a lovely place to cook and makes a real hub for the house. Up to the first floor and you discover bedrooms two and three. Both rooms are doubles and again bright spaces and ideal for those looking to rent out a room or two. To the top floor you have the master bedroom, again a double with ample fitted wardrobes and conveniently an ensuite. The master bathroom also sits at this level and is modern with a sumptuous feel. Outside you have the charming courtyard garden, a real suntrap that also offers storage and an outside WC. A premier location within the heart of SE1, perfect for those looking to enjoy the bars and restaurants of nearby Southwark, Borough and South Bank. Transport links are fantastic with Borough, Southwark and London Bridge stations just a short distance away. Houses of this type in this location are a genuine rarity. Energy Efficiency Rating D. Council Tax Band E.
